H0.text: Regular array is where ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions.

H1.text: Incorrect array is the arrangement where ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions.

H2.text: Normal array is where ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions.

H3.text: Occasional array is the arrangement in which ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions.

A4.text: Ionic compounds in the solid state form lattice structures.

A5.text: The two principal factors in determining the form of the lattice are the relative charges of the ions and their relative sizes.
